page.title: 20TRANSPORT
page.content: There are two main means of transport which go through Birtley. There is a railway which links London to Edinburgh on the western side. Inter City 125s run on this line. The other main means of transport is the A1(M) which runs at the North East of Birtley. All kinds of vehicles run along the A1(M) like long distance buses, vans, lorries and cars. There is a Marshalling Yard down by the railway. At the Marshalling Yard the workers there make up trains, mostly goods trains, which carry oil and coal. There are lots of buses which go through Birtley every day. Lots of people in Birtley have cars and vans.
